Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Class StructurePropagation<KEY>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.StructurePropagation<KEY>
  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - type of key.
    class StructurePropagation<KEY>
extends Object
    Means of communicating information about splits, caused by insertion, from lower levels of the tree up to parent and potentially all the way up to the root. The content of StructurePropagation is acted upon when we are traversing back up along the "traversal path" (see org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree). Level where StructurePropagation is evaluated is called "current level". Point of reference is mid child in current level and this is the parts of interest: 
            ┌─────────┬──────────┐
        │ leftKey │ rightKey │
        └─────────┴──────────┘
       ╱          │           ╲
 [leftChild]  [midChild]  [rightChild]
     ╱            │             ╲
    v             v              v
    • midChild - the child that was traversed to/through while traversing down the tree.
    • leftChild - left sibling to midChild.
    • rightChild - right sibling to midChild.
    • leftKey - if position of midChild in current level is n then leftKey is key at position n-1. If n==0 then leftKey refer to leftKey in parent in a recursive manor.
    • rightKey - if position of midChild in current level is n then rightKey is the key at position n. If n==keyCount then rightKey to rightKey in parent in a recursive manor.
    If position of midChild n > 0. 
     Current level-> [...,leftKey,rightKey,...]
                    ╱        │         ╲
              leftChild  midChild  rightChild
                  ╱          │           ╲
                 v           v            v
 Child nodes-> [...] <───> [...] <────> [...]
    If position of midChild n == 0. 
    
 Parent node->          [...,leftKey,...]
                   ┌────────┘       └────────┐
                   v                         v
 Current level-> [...] <───────────> [rightKey,...]
                     │               │        ╲
                 leftChild       midChild    rightChild
                     │               │          ╲
                     v               v           v
 Child nodes->     [...] <───────> [...] <───> [...]
    * If position of midChild n == keyCount. 
    
 Parent node->                  [...,rightKey,...]
                           ┌────────┘       └───────┐
                           v                        v
 Current level->    [...,leftKey] <─────────────> [...]
                       /        │                 |
                 leftChild  midChild          rightChild
                     /          │                 |
                    v           v                 v
 Child nodes->   [...] <────> [...] <─────────> [...]

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      (package private) KEY bubbleKey
      See keyReplaceStrategy.
      (package private) boolean hasLeftChildUpdate
      Left child pointer needs to be replaced by leftChild.
      (package private) boolean hasLeftKeyReplace  
      (package private) boolean hasMidChildUpdate
      Mid child pointer needs to be replaced by midChild.
      (package private) boolean hasRightChildUpdate
      Right child pointer needs to be replaced by rightChild OR, if hasRightKeyInsert is true rightChild should be inserted as a completely new additional child, moving old right child to the right.
      (package private) boolean hasRightKeyInsert
      rightKey should be inserted at right keys position (not replacing old right key).
      (package private) boolean hasRightKeyReplace  
      (package private) StructurePropagation.KeyReplaceStrategy keyReplaceStrategy
      Depending on keyReplaceStrategy either replace left / right key with leftKey / rightKey or replace left / right key by bubbleKey (with strategy bubble rightmost from subtree).
      (package private) long leftChild
      New version of left sibling to mid child.
      (package private) KEY leftKey
      See keyReplaceStrategy.
      (package private) long midChild
      New version of the child that was traversed to/through while traversing down the tree.
      (package private) long rightChild
      New right sibling to midChild, depending on hasRightKeyInsert this can be simple replace of an insert.
      (package private) KEY rightKey
      See keyReplaceStrategy.
      (package private) static StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_LEFT_CHILD  
      (package private) static StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_MID_CHILD  
      (package private) static StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_RIGHT_CHILD

    • Field Detail

      • leftKey

        final KEY leftKey
        See keyReplaceStrategy.

      • rightKey

        final KEY rightKey
        See keyReplaceStrategy.

      • bubbleKey

        final KEY bubbleKey
        See keyReplaceStrategy.

      • leftChild

        long leftChild
        New version of left sibling to mid child.

      • midChild

        long midChild
        New version of the child that was traversed to/through while traversing down the tree.

      • rightChild

        long rightChild
        New right sibling to midChild, depending on hasRightKeyInsert this can be simple replace of an insert.

      • hasLeftChildUpdate

        boolean hasLeftChildUpdate
        Left child pointer needs to be replaced by leftChild.

      • hasRightChildUpdate

        boolean hasRightChildUpdate
        Right child pointer needs to be replaced by rightChild OR, if hasRightKeyInsert is true rightChild should be inserted as a completely new additional child, moving old right child to the right.

      • hasMidChildUpdate

        boolean hasMidChildUpdate
        Mid child pointer needs to be replaced by midChild.

      • hasRightKeyInsert

        boolean hasRightKeyInsert
        rightKey should be inserted at right keys position (not replacing old right key).

      • keyReplaceStrategy

        StructurePropagation.KeyReplaceStrategy keyReplaceStrategy
        Depending on keyReplaceStrategy either replace left / right key with leftKey / rightKey or replace left / right key by bubbleKey (with strategy bubble rightmost from subtree). In the case of bubble, leftKey / rightKey is used to find "common ancestor" of leaves involved in merge. See org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree.

      • hasLeftKeyReplace

        boolean hasLeftKeyReplace

      • hasRightKeyReplace

        boolean hasRightKeyReplace

        static final StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_LEFT_CHILD

      • UPDATE_MID_CHILD

        static final StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_MID_CHILD

      • UPDATE_RIGHT_CHILD

        static final StructurePropagation.StructureUpdate UPDATE_RIGHT_CHILD
